channel.title: REQ: I need a runescape sig
channel.description:
Theme: I would really like something for a runescape gold store. I would like to have a wealthy character with full dragon and a blue partyhat, in a pile of gold.
Colour: i would like a very light red at the top and as the colour reaches the bottem it becomes a more, dark red.
Texture: i would like a stoney texture as if someone did this on a bumpy stone.
Text: i would like the text to be ALGERIAN, a thick bold type of font. It looks like a middle ages type of writing which i need. If you can find anything that would look better with a middle ages type of look feel free, all leters should be capital please. It should say "THE FU SUPERIOR" without the " in the bottem left corner of the sig. I would like it to be white so you can see the contrast between the dark purple and the white text.
it should be about 5 by 8cm

item.title: REQ: I need a runescape sig
item.dc:creator: @Unid_H4x0r Unid H4x0r
item.description:
@Unid_H4x0r wrote:

[quote=“kloplop321, post:10, topic:166297”]that’s a really high def one…[/quote]But Shrek?×

item.title: REQ: I need a runescape sig
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:7, topic:166297”][quote author=davidude36 link=topic=225461.msg1946307#msg1946307 date=1198361332]

Bad explanation, very bad one.
Along with a horrible render.

Pointless post, at least post a better explanation to provide evidence for your accusation, and even perhaps a better render.
[/quote]

I’m too lazy…
A better defenition:

Renders are cut outs of anything you can imagine.

Heres a better render :
http://www.imagehustler.com/1107/1196241411.png[/quote]

His was an example. You just said yours was better because it was higher quality. It’s still the same as his render… just high quality.

Read full topic

A RENDER: a .png file that has been trimmed out of a oringal .jpg…goes with any bg…example:

orginal from website: http://www.sigtutorials.com/img/8/render.png

did you notice the backgrounds? how its transparent…thats a render.
